title: Philip Glass
summary: Philip Morris[1] Glass (born January 31, 1937)[2] is an American composer and pianist. He is widely regarded as one of the most influential composers of the late 20th century.[3][4][5] Glass's work has been associated with minimalism, being built up from repetitive phrases and shifting layers.[6] Glass describes himself as a composer of "music with repetitive structures",[7] which he has helped evolve stylistically.[8][9]
